name: Robotex
tagline: Adventures in robotics with Mindstorm EV3 and Elixir
body:
# Day One - June 19, 2015

First things first: All Hail to [Torben Hoffman](http://www.elixirconf.eu/elixirconf2015/torben-hoffmann)! Torben is pioneering the use of Elixir (and concurrency-oriented programming) to program Mindstorm robots. His [talk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C8SZaV96_vk) is what got me fired up. Torben generously [offered to help](https://twitter.com/LeHoff/status/611789138342342656) as I stumble along. (Thank you!)

So. I received the Lego Mindstorm EV3 kit and a microSD card yesterday. ![ev3](https://twitter.com/jfcloutier/status/611880757913587712)

As soon as I can pry my Will, my 12 year-old son from it, my next steps will be to follow Torben's instructions from his [Elixir Conf 2015 slides](http://www.elixirconf.eu/static/upload/media/14382623667112154elixirconflego.pdf) and:

1. Install the [ev3dev](http://www.ev3dev.org/) Linux kernel with EV3 hardware drivers
2. Install Erlang and Elixir on the card
3. Install Torben's Elixir [EV3](https://github.com/lehoff/ev3) and [EV3 Bluetooth](https://github.com/lehoff/ev3bt)libraries
4. Boot the EV3 brick from the SD card.
5. Build a robot (with Will of course)
6. Write and run "Hello robot"  

Let's see how easy or hard it will be for me to get there.
